comments.raw_text:
A new profile has been used. It happens in 5.0 or 6.0b2.

STR:
1. Go to the ref. URL.
2. Click "Recherche" on the left to display search fields.
3. Type "40" below "entrer le numero de l'adresse recherchée" and "rue blanche" below "entrer le nom de la rue".
4. Click "Rechercher".

Result:
A blank popup is displayed.

Expected behavior:
A popup containing "Thème Adresses (APUR) : 1 objet trouvé" should be displayed after a delay as it is in IE 9 and Chrome 12.
comments.author: scoobidiver@netcourrier.com

comments.text:
Works for me:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686 (x86_64); en-US; rv:1.9.2.18) Gecko/20110614 Firefox/3.6.18

Reproduced:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0a2) Gecko/20110717 Firefox/7.0a2
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110717 Firefox/8.0a1

The pop-up contains just "</body></html>".


Last good nightly: 2010-10-13
First bad nightly: 2010-10-14

Pushlog:
http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=f6e81dd5a125&tochange=ad0a0be8be74
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
